intro: Relhania dumosa, commonly known as the African wild coffee, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, red drupe that contains a single seed. Relhania dumosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
